Strike continues in South Korea
articles.content:
Strike continues in South Korea
   Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- The trade union of the Ulsan factory of the Hyun Dai Precision Ind. Co., Ltd. continued a strike opposing the reactionary "restructuring", a Seoul-based radio reported.
   The organization made more than 2,000 unionists go to work regularly and then held rallies, and so on. At all workshops and went on a strike under the plan for all-out strike.
   It declared that if the  management side forces  workers to work in a bid to foil the strike, it will staunchly struggle to check the  management side's act.

articles.title: Russian embassy officials visit Sinchon  Museum
articles.content:
Russian embassy officials visit Sinchon  Museum
    Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Russian ambassador to Korea Valery Denisov and embassy officials visited the Sinchon  Museum on Tuesday in the month of international solidarity with the Korean people (June 25-july 27).
   The U.S. aggressors who occupied Sinchon  county at the time of our strategic temporary retreat  during the Korean war killed 35,383 innocent people, one fourth of the county's population, in 52 days.   
   The guests expressed indignation, going round exhibits and visual aid materials in the museum that show the brutal massacre by the U.S.
   They laid bouquets before the tombs of 400 mothers and 102 children and observed a moment's silence.
   The ambassador said that the Korean war imposed immeasurable misfortunes and sufferings upon the Korean people. The land of Sinchon  fully shows the history of tragedy the Korean people sustained, he added.

Statement of CILRECO
articles.content:
Statement of CILRECO
    Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- The International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea (CILRECO) issued a statement on June 25 condemning the South Korean authorities  recent provocations in the West Sea of Korea.   The statement said that the reckless act of South Korean authorities is part of the attempts to put into practice the U.S. "operation plan 5027-98" which is aiming at an armed invasion of the DPRK.   
   It stressed that CILRECO bitterly condemns the adventurous move of the U.S. and South Korean authorities to drive the situation in the Korean peninsula to the extreme pitch of strain and ignite a new war. It  strongly demanded they stop promptly it.
   It called upon all the peace-loving forces of the world to take correct understanding of the gravity and consequences of the incident and conduct energetic activities against the new war provocation maneuvers of the U.S. and South Korean authorities.

articles.title: Japan's bad habit
S. Korean authorities' military provocations denounced
Japan's plan to ship plutonium
articles.content:
Japan's plan to ship plutonium
    Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- The South Korean Federation of environment movement  reportedly held a rally denouncing Japan, the world leading buyer of plutonium, in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul concerned, it was caused by the deliberate and premeditated armed provocations of the South Korean war hawks from A to Z.
The top brass-hats of the South Korean Army issued an order to fire bullets and shells at warships of the north to wipe them out. Encouraged by this, the provocateurs ran wild,  firing thousands of bullets and shells. Their reckless provocations have been unabated till now since June 15.    
   The provocateurs' shameless talk about "provocations" from someone is a revelation of their attempt to find a pretext to unleash a war of aggression on the north.
   By his call for intensifying "alert posture"  the South Korean chief executive meant establishing a perfect combat posture for a war against the north. The extremely tense military confrontation between the north and south suggests that a new war is imminent.   If the South Korean war hawks think they will survive a new war which may bring disastrous  calamities to the nation, it is a foolish dream.   If they unleash a new war at any cost despite our warnings, they will certainly pay a high price and go to ruin.

articles.title: Great leadership over global cause of socialism
articles.content:
Great leadership over global cause of socialism
    Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today carries a signed article on the great leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il over the global cause of socialism.
   The human cause of independence, the cause of socialism, is now winning victory after victory  in defiance of the vicious and persistent obstructive maneuvers of the imperialists and reactionaries, the article says, and goes on:   The miraculous realities show that the great leader Kim Jong Il has wisely led the struggle for the victory of the human cause of independence, the cause of socialism.

Anthology of poems and book on Korea published in   Russia
articles.content:
Anthology of poems and book on Korea published in   Russia
   Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- "Eternal Sun", an anthology of poems written by Russian writer Vasily Grishayev, was published at the "Paleya-Mishin" Publishing House and "Leader and Destiny of Nation", a book written by Alexandr Brezhnev, at the "Patriot" Newspaper Publishing House.   The anthology of poems carries a photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il among children.   The poems extol the President Kim Il Sung and the General Secretary Kim Jong Il as the eternal sun and highly praise the brilliant revolutionary exploits of the anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk.   
   The poems express the ardent feelings of love and solidarity with the heroic Korean people who are steadfastly defending the socialist banner.
   The book carries a photo of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il giving on-the-spot guidance to Pyongyang city construction and articles introducing Korea.   It deals with the great traits of Kim Jong Il and his outstanding role for the development of the world revolution.

Greetings to Burundian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Burundian President
   Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings on Tuesday to Pierre Buyoya, President of Burundi, on the occasion of its National Day.
   Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished the President and people of Burundi great success in their work for national unity and peace and prosperity of their country.

articles.title: DPRK FM meets new ambassador of Tunisia
articles.content:
DPRK FM meets new ambassador of Tunisia
   Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun today met and conversed in a friendly atmosphere with newly-appointed Tunisian ambassador to Korea Lahbib Mohamed Mongi  who paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Heat damage in Korea
articles.content:
Heat damage in Korea
    Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Unusual heat is going on in Korea.
   According to information available at the central weather forecast institute of the hydrometeorological bureau, the noon maximum temperature was 36 degrees centigrade in Pyongyang on June 29. It was 34 degrees centigrade on June 29, Juche 9 (1920), an all-time high in the history of meteorological observations. It was 37 degrees centigrade in Phyongsong, three degrees centigrade higher than the maximum temperature in June.   The average temperature was higher than that of last year in most areas. Those areas had a small amount of precipitation while the ratio of hours of sunshine was far high.   
   Agriculture is suffering from the heat which is going on from early June.
   The heat came at a time when the crops badly need more water than ever before, an adversely affecting the growth of maize, rice  and other crops. As a consequence, the tassels and leaves of Indian corns are withering and the roots of rice plants grow rotten because of high temperature of water in paddies.
   Hard hit are crops in dry fields in intermediate and mountainous areas.
   Water has run out in reservoirs and rivers and streams have dried up owing to the heat.
   The heat is expected to last for several days.
